resources.string: ThinkQuote
\"You must sacrifice the present for a better future.\"
\"Bear as much responsibility as you possibly can.\"
\"Be as dangerous as you can, carefully. Be as dangerous as you possibly can and still be civilized.\"
\"Motivation gets you going. Good habits keep you going.\" -Jim Ryan
\"Familiarity breeds contempt.\" -Aesop (620 BC to 564 BC)
\"A liar will not be believed, even when they speak the truth.\" -Aesop (620 BC to 564 BC)
\"A crust eaten in peace is better than a banquet partaken in anxiety.\" -Aesop
\"Every truth has two sides; it is as well to look at both, before we commit ourselves to either.\" - Aesop
\"Any excuse will serve a tyrant.\" -Aesop
\"We would often be sorry if our wishes were gratified.\" - Aesop
\"After all is said and done. More is said and done\" -Aesop
\"The little reed, bending to the force of the wind, soon stood upright again when the storm had passed.\" -Aesop
\"The man who can keep a secret may be wise, but he is not half as wise as the man with no secrets to keep.\" -Edgar Watson Howe
\"Three things can not stay hidden: the sun, the moon, The Truth.\" -Buddha
\"If we could read the secret history of our enemies, we should find in each man\'s life sorrow and suffering enough to disarm all hostility.\" -Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
\"Man is not what he thinks he is, he is what he hides.\" -Andr\u00E9 Malraux
\"Work from your calendar. Not your To-do list. 41\% of items on the To-do list don\'t get done.\"
